medical_history.chief_complaint: Pregnancy during incarceration and associated medical care
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms A has been involved with the justice system since 2003 and reported a 6-year habit of heroin use. She received a 1-year jail sentence during the second trimester of her current pregnancy. During her incarceration, she experienced an episode of labor near term.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Heroin use for 6 years, nicotine dependence (1-pack-per-day cigarette smoking habit), and inhaler-dependent asthma. She has serologic evidence for hepatitis B and C with negative viral titers and normal liver function test results.
medical_history.family_history: Ms A is unmarried and has two older children cared for by family members while her newborn is with her in a community-based parenting program.
medical_history.social_history: Long-standing substance use (heroin and smoking), involvement with the justice system including 10 incarcerations, and recent paroled release to a community-based residential parenting program.
